trans-unit.source: Displays a button-like user interface (UI) for use in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell> class is a specialized type of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> used to display a button-like UI.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn> is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.CellTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is initialized to a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell>.

To pattern the cells within a column after an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell>, set the column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.CellTemplate%2A> property to the cell to use as a pattern.

To respond to user button clicks, handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellClick?displayProperty=fullName> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellContentClick?displayProperty=fullName> event.

In the event handler, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellEventArgs.ColumnIndex%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine whether the click occurred a the button column.
You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellEventArgs.RowIndex%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to determine whether the click occurred in a particular button cell.
The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell.
Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change.
Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.

When visual styles are enabled, the buttons in a button column are painted using a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ButtonRenderer>, and cell styles specified through properties such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.DefaultCellStyle%2A> have no effect.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell"></xref> class.
Creates an exact copy of this cell.

Override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.Clone%2A> method whenever you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell> and add new properties to the derived class.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the cloned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell"></xref>.
Creates a new accessible object for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell"></xref>.

If you do not explicitly call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.CreateAccessibilityInstance%2A> method, it will be called when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.AccessibilityObject%2A> property is referenced.
To get or set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.AccessibilityObject%2A> property, you must add a reference to the Accessibility assembly installed with the .NET Framework.
A new <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.DataGridViewButtonCellAccessibleObject"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell"></xref>.
Gets the type of the cell's hosted editing control.
This overridden property always returns `null` because there is no associated Windows hosted control; the button-like user interface is rendered.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the underlying editing control.
Gets or sets the style determining the button's appearance.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.FlatStyle%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.FlatStyle%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle"></xref> values.
The specified value when setting this property is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle"></xref> value.
Gets the type of the formatted value associated with the cell.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> representing the type of the cell's formatted value.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's content area, which is calculated using the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> and cell style.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's contents.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's error icon, if one is displayed.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's error icon, if one is displayed; otherwise, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Empty"></xref>.
Calculates the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents the style of the cell.
The zero-based row index of the cell.
The cell's maximum allowable size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
Retrieves the text associated with the button.
This method is useful to retrieve the text of a cell in a shared row, which cannot store cell values locally and remain shared.
You must pass in the actual row index because shared rows have indexes of -1.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
The index of the cell's parent row.

The value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell"></xref> or the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.Text"></xref> value of the owning column if <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.UseColumnTextForButtonValue"></xref> is `true`.
Indicates whether a row is unshared if a key is pressed while the focus is on a cell in the row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.KeyDownUnsharesRow%2A> method is called just before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnKeyDown%2A> method.

It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnKeyDown%2A> with the same <xref:System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs> argument has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
The index of the cell's parent row.
`true` if the user pressed the SPACE key without modifier keys; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether a row is unshared when a key is released while the focus is on a cell in the row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.KeyUpUnsharesRow%2A> method is called just before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnKeyUp%2A> method.

It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnKeyUp%2A> with the same <xref:System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs> argument has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
The index of the cell's parent row.
`true` if the user released the SPACE key; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.MouseDownUnsharesRow%2A> method is called just before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnMouseDown%2A> method.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnMouseDown%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
`true` if the user pressed the left mouse button; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer moves over a cell in the row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.MouseEnterUnsharesRow%2A> method is called just before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OnMouseEnter%2A> method.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.OnMouseEnter%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.
`true` if the cell was the last cell receiving a mouse click; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse pointer leaves the row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.MouseLeaveUnsharesRow%2A> method is called just before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnMouseLeave%2A> method.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.MouseLeaveUnsharesRow%2A> must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnMouseLeave%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row specified by `rowIndex`.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.
`true` if the button displayed by the cell is in the pressed state; otherwise, `false`.
Indicates whether a row will be unshared when the mouse button is released while the pointer is on a cell in the row.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.MouseUpUnsharesRow%2A> method is called just before the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnMouseUp%2A> method.
It must return `true` if the call to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.OnMouseUp%2A> has the effect of unsharing the row.
It should return `false` otherwise.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
`true` if the left mouse button was released; otherwise, `false`.
Called when a character key is pressed while the focus is on the cell.
When activated by the SPACE key, this method updates the cell's user interface (UI).
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnKeyDown%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyDown?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.
Called when a character key is released while the focus is on the cell.

When activated by the SPACE key, this method updates the cell's user interface (UI) and raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellClick%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.OnCellContentClick%2A> events on the owning <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnKeyUp%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.KeyUp?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data
The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.
Called when the focus moves from the cell.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnLeave%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Leave?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.
`true` if focus left the cell as a result of user mouse click; `false` if focus left due to a programmatic cell change.
Called when the mouse button is held down while the pointer is on the cell.
If activated by depressing the left mouse button, this method updates the cell's user interface (UI).
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseDown%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when the mouse pointer moves out of the cell.
If the cell's button is not in its normal state, this method causes the cell's user interface (UI) to be updated.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseLeave%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseLeave> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
The row index of the current cell, or -1 if the cell is not owned by a row.
Called when the mouse pointer moves while it is over the cell.
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseMove%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseMove?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when the mouse button is released while the pointer is on the cell.
If activated by the left mouse button, this method updates the cell's user interface (UI).
This method is similar to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseUp%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
It is called in the same circumstances in which a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseUp?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised, but it does not actually raise the event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Paints the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to paint the cell.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that needs to be repainted.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the bounds of the cell that is being painted.
The row index of the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that specifies the state of the cell.
The data of the cell that is being painted.
The formatted data of the cell that is being painted.
An error message that is associated with the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that contains formatting and style information about the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle"></xref> that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts"></xref> values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.
Returns the string representation of the cell.
The string representation that is returned includes the row index and column index of the cell.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that represents the current cell.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the owning column's text will appear on the button displayed by the cell.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.FormattedValue%2A> of a button cell is displayed as text on the button.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.UseColumnTextForButtonValue%2A> property allows you to either set the button text for each cell, or to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.Text%2A> property value of the parent column for all of the button cells.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.UseColumnTextForButtonValue%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonCell.UseColumnTextForButtonValue%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.

`true` if the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value"></xref> property will automatically match the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewButtonColumn.Text"></xref> property of the owning column; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the data type of the values in the cell.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> representing the data type of the value in the cell.
